venue.name: Microsoft New England Research & Development Center (NERD)

item.description:
Our March/April BizSpark Meetup will be held on Thursday, April 1st at Microsoft Research Center located at One Memorial Drive in Cambridge. The security officer will direct attendees to the correct floor. There is parking available in the building. Parking is free on the street in front of the building at 6 PM.

At 7:00 PM attorney Tim Ehrlich will present on Legal Considerations for Startups. Tim is very modest, but he truly is a world-class attorney with Gunderson Dettmer and has strong ties in both Boston as a Concord native and in Silicon Valley where he practiced for many years. Tim has represented MySpace.com in their joining OpenSocial.org and represents Dean Kamen, the inventor of the Segway.

At 8:00 PM Josh Bob of BizSpark startup Textaurant will pitch his startup to Aaron O'Hearn of Palm Ventures. Aaron O'Hearn offers deep hands-on experience in the web startup industry catering to restaurants as clients. He was co-founder of BuyYourFriendADrink.com which was sold to well-known social apps company LivingSocial where he was market Manager. Aaron is also Co-Founder of Initial Advantage, a non-profit who's mission is to connect emerging entrepreneurs with the resources and guidance they need to be successful.


After the presentation | demonstration, we will go around the room introducing ourselves and asking the group for advice | opinions on any startup-related issues members are facing.

Microsoft will provide pizza. What a generous organization!

Please RSVP and bring guests.
item.name: Legal Considerations for Startups | Textaurant Startup Pitch to Aaron O'Hearn
